title: Vax-Unvax: Let the Science Speak with Prof Brian Hooker, Ph.D. | World Council for Health
description: Professor Brian Hooker discusses the health outcomes of vaccinated vs unvaccinated children with the World Council for Health.
cleaned_text: Speak with Prof Brian Hooker, Ph.D. Joining the World Council for Health live from the U.S. on the 28th of August 2023 to [discuss](https://worldcouncilforhealth.org/multimedia/general-assembly-meeting-101/) the health outcomes of vaccinated vs unvaccinated children was Professor Brian Hooker, Ph.D., co-author of the new book [Vax-Unvax: Let the Science Speak](https://www.skyhorsepublishing.com/9781510766969/vax-unvax/). The book, co-written by Robert F Kennedy Jr, is based on over one hundred studies in the peer-reviewed literature that consider vaccinated versus unvaccinated populations. Each study is analyzed, and health differences among infants, children, and adults who have been vaccinated and those who have not are presented and put in context. Readers will find information on: - The infant/child vaccination schedule - Thimerosal in vaccines - Live virus vaccines - The human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine - Vaccination and Gulf War illness - Influenza (flu) vaccines - Hepatitis B vaccination - The Covid-19 vaccine - Vaccines during pregnancy Who is Prof Brian Hooker? - Brian Hooker is senior director of science and research at [Children's Health Defense](https://childrenshealthdefense.org/)and professor emeritus of biology at Simpson University in Redding, California. - In 1985, he earned his bachelor of science degree in chemical engineering, from California State Polytechnic University, Pomona, California. Hooker earned his master of science degree in 1988 and his doctorate in 1990, both in biochemical engineering, from Washington State University, in Pullman, Washington. - He has many accomplishments to his credit including: co-inventor for five patents, recipient of the Battelle Entrepreneurial Award in 2001 and a Federal Laboratory Consortium Recognition Award in 1999, for his work on "Reactive Transport in 3-Dimensions." - The breadth of his more than 60 science and engineering papers have been published in internationally recognized, peer reviewed journals. Hooker has been active in the autism community since 2001 and has a 19 year old son with autism. - Hooker currently serves on the board of trustees for Focus for Health. In 2013 and 2014, he worked with CDC whistleblower, Dr William Thompson, to expose fraud and corruption within vaccine safety research in the CDC which led to the release of over 10,000 pages of documents.
